seq.a: The examination process can be summarised as follows.
the female patient is examined by an outpatient physician, who decides whether she is healthy or needs to undertake an additional examination.

xor.c: whether she is healthy or needs to undertake an additional examination?|healthy|needs to undertake an additional examination
xor.a: the physician fills out the examination form and the patient can leave.

seq.a: an examination and follow-up treatment order is placed by the physician who additionally fills out a request form.
he request form includes details about the examination requested and refers to a suitable lab.
the outpatient physician informs the patient about potential risks.
a delegate of the physician arranges an appointment of the patient with one of the wards.
The latter is then responsible for taking a sample to be analysed in the lab later.
the required examination and sampling is prepared by a nurse of the ward based on the information provided by the outpatient section.
a ward physician takes the sample requested.
He further sends it to the lab indicated in the request form and conducts the follow-up treatment of the patient.
a physician of the lab validates its state and decides whether the sample can be used for analysis or whether it is contaminated and a new sample is required.
the analysis is performed by a medical technical assistant of the lab
a lab physician validates the results.
a physician from the outpatient department makes the diagnosis and prescribes the therapy for the patient.
